page.title: 11Wonderworld, Corby
page.content: The answer to unemployment in Corby would be the development of Wonderworld a 21st century themepark. Wonderworld is the idea of a company called Group Five Holdings, who propose to turn a vast area of exhausted ironworkings at Weldon into the European equivalent of America's Disneyland. The theme park was supposed to have been started two years ago but the planners claim that difficulties in raising the capital required for the first stage- over 100m pounds and the lack of a major bank to deal with the project have delayed this. Many local people are very sceptical that it will ever be built, although Corby District Council assure us that it will. The park is designed to include high- technology computerised games and leisure facilities, a golf course designed by the famous Jack Nicklaus
